SIMMONS sits in a chair at a poolside table shuffling a d of cards in his hand.

That Goldfinger's a fabulous card player.

Allow a man to stop off for a quick one on route.  36. (exasperated) It has not been perfected after years of patient research and time for that purpose, double-o-seven. "Q" gets out of the car and shuts the door. Bond glances the gadgets in his hand then leans an arm on the roof of car. And incidentally, we'd appreciate its return, along with all your other equipment -- intact, for once, when you return from the field.

Well, you'd be surprised the amount of wear-and-tear that goes on out there in the field. Anything else? "Q" walks forward. DOLLY IN on Bond, looking bored. Well, I won't keep you for more than an hour or so if you give me your undivided attention. We've installed some rather interesting modifications. Bond signs and leans more heavily against the car. ugn walks around to the driver's side and points in through t window. You see this arm here? Bond looks in through the passenger window.
"Q's" hand reaches inside and taps the top of the console
Now open the top, and inside are your defense mechanism controls: "Q" opens the top, revealing numerous switches. He points many (but not all) of them.  37.
smoke screen, oil slick, rear bullet-proof screen, and left and right front-wing machine guns. He closes the top.
looks on patiently but without much interest.
Now this one I'm particularly keen about. Bond looks inside again.
"Q's" finger points to it.
You see the gear lever here? Now, if you take the top off... (he flips the top open, revealing a red button) ... you'll find a little red button. He closes the top again.
"on Whatever you do, don't touch it.
And why not?
He holds his hands over the roof. Because you'll release this section of the roof... (points inside again) and engage and then fire the passenger ejector seat. (throws a hand upwards) Whoosh!  38.
Ejector seat? You're joking!
"on (miffed) I never joke about my work, double- o-seven.
looks back chagrined.
A golf shop and large hotel are in b.g. GOLFERS walk past f.g. pulling wheeled golf carts. A gold Rolls Royce is pa near the hotel, and beyond it Bond's Aston-Martin.

The proprietor, BLACKING, winds tape around a golf club i f.g. Goldfinger walks in. He is dressed like his name: brown coat over a yellow sweater, brown striped tie, brow golfing pants and shoes, and he holds a matching brown ca
Ready, Blacking?
Yes, sir. DOLLY BACK to reveal Bond in f.g. He wears a purple sweat and black slacks and is looking at a rack of golf clubs.
(to Goldfinger) Uh, there's an old member dropped by, sir. Same handicap as yours. I wondered if you would rather play with him?
Where is he? Blacking turns to Bond.
Uh, Mister Bond?  39.
turns to Blacking.
Yes?
This is Mister Goldfinger.
turns and looks at Bond. He studies him a moment, then speaks.
How do you do?
looks back at Goldfinger.
How do you do?
keeps looking at Bond.
keeps looking at Goldfinger.
You can go straight off. The first tee is clear.
DOLLY IN as Bond walks past them to the door.
Fine.
I'll get Hawker to carry for you, Mister Bond.
(turning back) Well, that'll be splendid. (to Goldfinger ) Shall we make it a shilling a hole?  40.
Um-hmm. Bond smiles at him and walks out the door.
As Bond emerges we hear Goldfinger talking to Blacking:
I'll take some tees.
Ah, yes. Of course. Bond suddenly looks ahead and stops.
ODDJOB steps into a rigid stance right across from him. A golf bag hangs incongruously from his shoulder.
Goldfinger comes out of the shop behind him, smiling at B concerned look.
Oh, you must excuse Oddjob, Mister Bond. He's an admirable manservant, but mute. He's not a very good caddy. PAN on them as they walk past Oddjob.
(shrugging at Oddjob) Golf is not yet the national game of Korea, eh? Oddjob waits until they are some distance away then follo

Bond stands on a putting green at his ball. He wears a bl hat and takes aim with his putter. Goldfinger's ball is closer to the hole than Bond's. HAWKER stands nearby with Bond's golf bag. Bond putts and sinks the ball.  41. PAN on him as he walks to the hole, revealing Goldfinger approaching with his putter and Oddjob standing nearby. Goldfinger is in his sweater and wears his brown cap.
This meeting is not a coincidence, eh?
Goldfinger and Bond stand in f.g., with Oddjob and Hawkin standing in b.g. on opposite sides. Goldfinger leans down with his putter.
What's your game, Mister Bond?
- Bond looks at Goldfinger. - Goldfinger looks down taking aim. - His putter moves back and forth at his ball. - Bond keeps looking at him.
My game? - Goldfinger keeps looking down.

You didn't come here to play golf. - His putter keeps moving back and forth. Suddenly Bond's gold bar lands beside it with a thud. - Goldfinger's eyes widen as he looks at the bar. - The bar glistens in the sunlight. - Goldfinger looks back at his ball. - His putter taps the ball, which rolls aside missing the hole. - Bond smirks slightly and looks at Goldfinger. - Goldfinger looks at the gold bar again then turns aside  42.
Goldfinger hands his putter to Oddjob as Bond picks up th gold bar and gives it to Hawker.
They walk together across the green.
The 1940 smelt from the Weigenhaler foundry at Essen.
Part of a smelt of six hundred.
They vanished in 1944.
When the Nazis were on the run.
And you have access to more?
Yes, from the same source.
Interesting.
They approach a teeing ground where a marker says "17."
Two holes to go.
Yes, and all square. Bond plants his ball on a tee.
Then you have no objection to increasing the stakes?
(getting into putting position) No. What do you have in mind?  43.
The bar of gold you have with you, naturally.
(looking up) It's worth five thousand pounds.
(laughing it off) Oh, I'll stake the cash equivalent.
Naturally. (he looks nervously down at his ball)
Bond raises his club to swing.
(suddenly) Strict rules of golf?
freezes in mid-stroke and lowers the club.
But of course.
nods and sways from side to side.
Bond swings at the ball, striking it cleanly across the fairway. Goldfinger watches it go. So does Oddjob.
The ball sails far away then lands.
Smiling tightly, Bond crosses Goldfinger, who takes a clu from Oddjob and approaches the tee. Bond watches.

Goldfinger sets his ball down and readies himself. Ina reverse angle on his legs, his club hits the ball squarel the ball flies into the distance. Goldfinger watches it go. So does Bond, who steps forward grinning.
Goldfinger's ball sails across an area of rough and lands some trees.
Bond looks over Goldfinger's shoulder at the rough, Oddjo behind them.
Oh, bad luck. You're in the rough. Goldfinger puts his hand on his hip then walks forward.
From left to right, Oddjob, Goldfinger, Bond and Hawker l for the ball in the rough.
paces near the trees, looking down. (Bond is no longer wh he was standing.)
search near the beginning of the rough.
Oh, what a pity. Here it is. They look down at a ball.
(picking it up) No, it's not. He plays a Slazenger One. Hawker hands Bond the ball. Bond looks at it. It is marke "Slazenger 7."
continues to look near the trees.  45.
(calling) Strict rules of golf, Goldfinger! Five minutes are almost up!
(continuing) A lost ball will cost you stroke and distance! Goldfinger keeps looking through the rough.
PAN on him as he walks with a hand in his trouser pocket. stops walking. TILT DOWN to his legs as a ball rolls out his trousers onto the turf. He raises his arm.
(calling) Aagh aagh!
looks over and waves his club.
Uh-huh. He walks off.
watch with concealed contempt. Goldfinger walks past them.
(innocently) I'm still training him as a caddy. Oddjob, off to the side, grins at Bond.
Successfully, too. He and Hawker walk off.  46.

Goldfinger walks to Oddjob in f.g. Meanwhile Bond and Haw walk toward the trees in b.g., looking around. Goldfinger looks down at "his" ball, which lays inches fr the fairway. It is marked "Slazenger 1."
Slazenger Number One. Good. He holds his hand out. Oddjob passes him a club.
Bond stops searching and looks up at Goldfinger. Hawker w up.
If that's his original ball, I'm Arnold Palmer.
'Tisn't.
How do you know?
I'm standing on it. Hawker looks down. Bond raises his foot revealing the bal
(laughing) Why you crafty old... Hawker starts to reach down.
Leave it. Bond holds up the other ball.
The ball you found, sir?
Yes. Slazenger Seven. (looking off) Let's have a little fun with Mister Goldfinger. He slips the ball into his pocket.  47.
Goldfinger, in f.g. with his back to us, swings his club strongly then walks forward.
Bond's ball lays inches from the cup, Goldfinger's a few away. Bond approaches his ball.
(to Goldfinger) Would you like me to mark it or knock it in?
Um-hmm, play it. Bond taps his ball into the cup. Goldfinger walks up to his ball.
This for a half.

That's right. Goldfinger leans over with his club. In an angle on his l he hits the ball and it rolls into the cup. Bond, hand in his pocket, looks up at him. Goldfinger rises haughtily and grins. Bond glances back at Hawker then, as we TILT DOWN, takes hand from his pocket. We glimpse the hidden ball in his h He reaches into the cup and withdraws two balls. TILT BAC to his face.
(to Goldfinger) One to go. That'll be the clincher.
Fine. Bond tosses a ball to Goldfinger, who reaches out gracefu and catches it. The foursome start walking.  48.
Did you switch them, sir?
Uh-huh.
Then we've got ‘em.
If he doesn't notice the switch.
Close shot of a marker that says "18." TRACK BACK as Goldfinger and Oddjob enter the teeing ground. Goldfinger reaches down with his ball.
approach. Hawker looks on, startled.
It's your honour, sir!
(holding his hand up) It's all right.
bends over and sets his ball on a tee. He rises. The ball falls off the tee.
Goldfinger angles his club then notices the ball on the ground. He reaches for it.
watch in suspense.
plants the ball on the tee again, then looks into the dis and readies his stroke.
keep watching.  49.
Goldfinger swings and hits the ball across the fairway. Hawker smiles at Bond. They walk forward.
The final hole. Goldfinger putts. His ball rolls into the cups Bond's ball is equidistant on the other side of the
Down in five.
(preparing to putt) I'll have to sink this to have the game, right? Bond putts. The ball curves away from the hole, just miss it.
Yaagh! You win, Goldfinger.
It seems I am too good for you. Bond reaches into the cup and takes out both balls. He lo at one.
Hmm. You play a Slazenger One, don't you? Goldfinger, who has been leaning triumphantly on his club approaches.
Yes. Why?
(holding Goldfinger's ball up) This is a Slazenger Seven. Goldfinger takes it. Bond holds up the other ball.
Here's my Penfold Hearts. Goldfinger looks in shock at the ball in his hand.  50.

You must have played the wrong ball somewhere on the eighteenth fairway. We are playing strict rules, so I'm afraid you lose the hole and the match. Goldfinger glares up at Oddjob. Oddjob looks back without expression. Goldfinger hurls his ball to the ground and walks off as smiles. Hawker approaches with the flag, grinning broadly and plants it beside the hole.

The gold Rolls Royce sits in f.g., beyond it Bond's Aston Martin. A number of statues adorn the clubhouse fagade. PAN on Oddjob as walks to the Rolls' trunk carrying Goldfinger's golf bag, revealing Bond dressed in a brown looking on with his hands in his pockets. Oddjob sets the in the trunk and backs away. DOLLY IN on Bond as he approaches the trunk. He takes a H from his pocket, primes it and plants it inside the trunk

DOLLY BACK as he approaches again carrying a folded umbre Bond gently strokes the car's gold exterior as Oddjob set umbrella in the trunk then closes an inner casing and the outer casing. At the same time Goldfinger approaches from the clubhouse b.g. He now wears a formal brown suit and hat. Bond backs away from the car, hands in his pockets, and f Goldfinger.
She's a beauty! Phantom three thirty-seven, isn't she?
DOLLY BACK as he walks up to Bond.
You are a clever, resourceful man, Mister Bond.  51.
Why, thank you.
Perhaps too clever. HOLD ON TWO-SHOT as Goldfinger looks Bond in the eye.
Twice our paths have crossed. Let's leave it at that. PAN on Goldfinger as he opens the car's back door.
I should have thought our first meeting would have convinced you.

Oh, I see. PAN on him as he walks over to Goldfinger. Goldfinger's l arm is linked around the window-frame, revealing a gold wristwatch and band, a gold cufflink and a gold ring. Odd stands watching on the other side of the car.
You're worried about me not giving you a return game.

Both of us know perfectly well what we are talking about, Mister Bond. But I see that it is necessary to remind you. Oddjob! PAN on Oddjob as he walks past the front of the car then stands at attention across from them.
Many people have tried to involve themselves in my affairs --
-- unsuccessfully. Goldfinger looks off at Oddjob then touches the brim of h hat and points into the distance.  52.
It is a classic Greek statue of a woman.

takes off his bowler hat, steps over to Bond and Goldfing and flings his hat at the statue. The hat flies through the air and crosses the statue, kno the head off. The head and hat land at the base of the statue.
look up at Oddjob, who walks off to retrieve his hat. DOL IN on Bond and Goldfinger.
Remarkable. But what does the club secretary have to say? GOLDFINGER. Oh, nothing, Mister Bond. I own the club. Goldfinger wipes his eye, opens the car door, gets in and lowers a tabletop.
I assume you want the check made out to cash.
That would be perfectly satisfactory. Goldfinger looks at him with a sneer.
PAN on him and he returns to the car straightening his ha He passes behind the car to the driver's side. Meanwhile Goldfinger tears a check from his checkbook and hands it Bond.
Goodbye, Mister Bond. Goldfinger shuts his door as Oddjob gets in behind the wh Bond plays with a ball in his hand then tosses it to Oddj who catches it.

Oh, uh... I believe this is yours.  53. Oddjob glares at Bond and squeezes the ball. Bond looks o The ball fractures into little pieces that Oddjob flings the ground. Bond rocks back on his heels, suitably impres

drives off. Bond turns fingering the check then walks ove his Aston-Martin and reaches inside. Bond's finger presses a button on the dashboard and the g opens, revealing the scope. He turns a dial and the scope glows green, shows a map of the area and blips. The blip indicator is moving away from the center of the scope.
The Rolls rises into the air accompanied by a mechanical lifting noise. The front license plate reads "AU1."

The car is on a hoist beneath an airplane and is being ra to the cargo hatch. PAN on a baggage handler driving by i cart containing four suitcases, one of which is gold-colo As the cart passes under the plane, DOLLY BACK to reveal Goldfinger and Oddjob approaching the steps to the passen compartment. Goldfinger motions to Oddjob, who hands their tickets toa STEWARDESS at the base of the steps, and the two of them up the steps.

head_text.subj: AT THE STOP OF THE STEPS

text: Goldfinger takes off his hat as he passes a STEWARDESS at top of the steps and enters the passenger compartment. Od follows keeping his hat on.
CRANE BACK from the plane to reveal the Aston-Martin in f and Bond behind the wheel looking at the scope, as we hea announcement:
(over loudspeaker ) British United Air-ferries announce the departure of their DS-400 flight to Geneva. Suddenly a voice calls out to Bond:  54.
Mister Bond? Bond looks over.
DOLLY BACK as the Security Officer approaches Bond.
That's all right. I've got you booked out on the next flight to Geneva, leaving in half an hour.
Oh. Thank you very much.
Right, sir. The Security Officer walks off.

looks back at the British United plane, which is starting taxi away. He opens the scope on his dashboard and turns the dial. T map alights showing the airport at the center of the scre and the blip indicator moving away from it.
TILT DOWN from towering mountains to a hilly road. Goldfinger's Rolls Royce drives up the road.
Oddjob drives. Goldfinger sits in back opening a newspape He scratches the side of his face.
Bond's Aston-Martin drives up the road from a town in b.g
Bond is driving. He looks down at the scope. It shows a map of Geneva. The blip indicating the Rolls i moving up the top half of the scope.  55.
The Rolls drives up the road, continuing to head uphill.
Goldfinger leans back with his hat over his eyes, snoozin He suddenly rubs his nose then relaxes again.
Bond looks down impatiently at the scope.

The Aston-Martin navigates a bend in the road. Just then yellow Ford Mustang rounds a corner behind it, following. Bond look in the rearview mirror. It shows the Mustang following. Then Bond's expression grows more interested a he looks back.
An attractive blonde is driving -- TILLY MASTERSON -- but expression is grim. She honks her horn.
The Mustang comes alongside the Aston-Martin.
looks over with an interested expression.
The Mustang races ahead of him.
grins. He looks ahead again at the Mustang, which now races perilously fast. Bond prepares to put on more speed but catches himself an slows down.
Discipline, double-o-seven. (unhappily) Discipline.  56.
The Mustang heads up the road. Inside, Tilly looks forwar grimly.
He looks down at the scope again. The blip indicator has become stationary, showing no movement.
The Rolls is stopped at the flower stall, which is manned five children. Goldfinger and Oddjob get out of the car.
Oddjob walks up to one of the children.
He keeps driving, his expression impatient.
The Aston-Martin continues up the road.

Oddjob stands beside the Rolls as Goldfinger approaches t children. SLOWLY ZOOM BACK to an extreme long shot reveal a much higher road in f.g. Bond's car has stopped on the high road and he gets out a looks down at Goldfinger.
turns away from the flower stall eating an orange. Oddjob behind him (in a process shot), approaches the children a

He stands on the high road looking down at Goldfinger. SL ZOOM BACK to an even longer shot revealing an even higher in f.g. A rifle barrel comes into view, aiming below, and then Ti lying prone and bracing the rifle on a boulder. She fires
The bullet strikes the pavement right in front of him. He ducks down then lies flat behind his car.  57.
moves away with the rifle.

Goldfinger gets back inside. Oddjob looks up at the hills and smirks, then gets behind the wheel. The Rolls drives away from the flower stall. ON a ROAD Tilly's car rounds a bend and heads downhill. Bond's car emerges from a side road behind her and follows.
looks ahead now with determination.
The two cars race down the road, Bond right behind Tilly. When they reach the flower stall, Bond passes her and spe ahead. Tilly follows, almost on his bumper, honking at hi

- Bond looks in his rearview mirror and grins, enthused b chase. - The mirror shows the Mustang following fast. - TRUCKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin races around a bend, th Mustang right behind it and trying to pass it. - Tilly sounds her horn again. - Bond, grinning more broadly, checks his rearview mirror - TRUCKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin starts swerving to bloc the Mustang from passing. A long horn blast sounds from t Mustang. - Bond politely gestures to the Mustang to pass him. - The Mustang swerves to the other side of the road. - Bond looks over at it. - His hand opens the console, revealing his weapon contro - The Aston-Martin races by with the Mustang almost besid - Bond reaches down.  58. - CLOSE SHOT - A REAR WHEEL: A hub decoration opens to re cutting blades on a spindle. They extend from the wheel o rod. - Tilly looks in her rearview-mirror. - Blades from Bond's front wheel slam into a front tire o Mustang. - Tilly looks over and screams. - Blades now retract from the Mustang's shredded rear tir then slam into it again and retract again. - Tilly's car skids off the road; both passenger-side tir are blown. - She clutches the steering wheel as her car bounces to a stop, then she strokes her face.
The Aston-Martin has stopped at the side of the road. Bon runs out, slamming the door behind him.
Bond runs up to her.
Are you all right? Here, let me help you. He opens the driver's door and she steps out.
You know, you're lucky to be alive.
No thanks to you. You should have pulled over further. She crosses behind the back of her car and looks at her t The rear tire is completely shredded.
Look at them!
A double blow-out! I've never seen one of these before.  59. Tilly looks over at Bond's car. It sits innocently on the side of the road.
How could new tires...?
Defect of some kind, most likely. (sits on the edge of her trunk) Anyway, I'm so glad that it's only the car and not you. You don't look like the sort of girl who should be ditched.
Never mind that. Please take me to the nearest garage.
Certainly. She crosses back to the driver's side and grabs her handb Bond follows.
By the way, my name Is Bond. Would you --
Um, as quickly as possible. She goes to the trunk. He shuts the driver's door. She op the trunk, takes out a suitcase and sets it down as he ta briefcase from her back seat.
I'll take that.
(handing it to her) Yes, of course. He picks up the suitcase and follows her to his car.
Bond drives, Tilly beside him. They look at each other.
What's your name, by the way?  60.
Soames. Tilly Soames. Bond glances in the rearview mirror.
sits on the back seat ledge with the initials "T.M." mark it.
Here for the hunting season? TI had a case just like that one. She glances back.
The initials on it are very visible.
It's for my ice skates.
Lovely sport. Where do you skate?
Saint Moritz.
I didn't know there was ice there this time of the year.
(suddenly points) There's a garage.
Bond's car drives in front b.g. and stops in f.g. Tilly immediately opens her door and gets out. She walks past t gas pumps toward the office.
(calling) Fraulein!
He reaches down to open the scope. Meanwhile, we hear Til  61.
(angrily) I've had an accident.

Bond turns the dial activating the scope. It alights. The beep indicator is stationary again, near a mountainside. Puzzled, Bond looks off as if the source is nearby, then looks at the scope again. The indicator remains stationary. We hear Tilly again:
How long will it take?... Thank you. Appreciate it. Bond looks down and turns off the scope then opens the do and starts to step out.
Bond emerges from the car as Tilly walks up to him.
They say it'll take twenty-four hours to get new tires. There's a hotel nearby.
Oh, jump in. I'll run you down.
That won't be necessary.
Well, I hate to leave you here alone. Bond reaches into the car and hands Tilly her suitcase.
I can take care of myself.
Yes, I'm sure you can. Bond reaches in again and hands her her briefcase.
(smiling to her) Well, don't forget to write. He gets in and shuts the door, leaving her there alone.  62.
The Aston-Martin backs away, turns, then heads back down road as Tilly watches.
PAN on the Aston-Martin as it rounds a bend across froma large green hillside. A factory complex at the base of th hillside comes into view. A sign on its main building say
The car stops across from the factory and Bond looks over it.
is an imposing edifice.
gazes at the complex then leans forward and looks up high
He drives off. TILT UP to the top of the hillside.

Bond, with a pair of binoculars around his neck, walks do from the crest of the hill. PAN on him till the factory b comes into view. He sits under a tree with his back to us looks through the binoculars at the factory.
Goldfinger's Rolls Royce sits in front of one of the buildings. Two GUARDS in blue jumpsuits tied with yellow sashes look inside it as THREE OTHER GUARDS approach.
He rests his arms on his knees.
Bond sits on the hillside again, arms on knees, but dress all in black. He glances at his watch.  63.
overlooking the factory. Lights show in some of the windo Bond starts to creep down the hill. He wears a black backpack.

head_text.subj: AT THE BASE OF THE HILL

text: Bond runs from the hillside onto a factory road, crosses and stops beside a brick building. He flattens his back against it for a moment then moves on. Just then two men in blue jumpsuits round the far corner the building, speaking together in Korean.
DOLLY BACK and PAN on Bond as he passes the building. The shadows of the other men cross it. He looks back then run ahead.

head_text.subj: AT THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING

text: Bond rounds the corner and leans back against the buildin then glances back. The other men round the corner of the building behind him. They are laughing. Bond runs off, passing some metal drums and a sign on a w that says, in German, "EINTRITT STRENGSTENS VERBOTEN" ("e strictly forbidden"). He quickly finds himself in a dead- blocked by another building. He looks back desperately.
The two guards continue forward.
runs back past the sign, mounts a fire-escape ladder and starts climbing up. He stops on a ledge, then climbs up t the next level.

Louvers on the building's windows provide ventilation. Bo comes around the corner, stopping on the ledge near the louvers. He looks down to see the two guards turn the oth way. Then he turns to the louvers and looks inside.
Goldfinger's Rolls is partially dismantled. WORKERS -- al them wearing blue jumpsuits and yellow sashes -- pass to from it as red smoke rises from a furnace in b.g.  64.
tilts the louvers so he can have a better view. He looks inside again.

The Roll's grill is in f.g. A worker removes one of the golden headlamps, walks back and sets it down. Meanwhile others remove one of the golden doors, carry it back and it down. At the same time, Goldfinger and LING -- a Chinese operat in a Mao jacket -- approach from b.g.:
Smuggling is an art, Mister Ling...
They pour molten gold into an ingot mold.
and art requires... Steam sounds from the melted gold, drowning out the rest his sentence.
(continuing) In this case, the bodywork of my Rolls Royce is eighteen carat gold.
keeps looking in through the louvers, excited at his find
Goldfinger escorts Ling past a dolly bearing gold ingots.

We dismantle it here. We reduce the gold in this special furnace, which in turn... (noise drowns him out) . weighing approximately two tons. He raises his fist to his mouth, coughing, then leads Lin off.  65.
I make six trips a year to the continent in the Rolls Royce, Mister Ling...
Bond looks downward in satisfaction. He has solved his ca He looks again through the louvers, then suddenly looks t side.
Ling exits the factory then leans against a railing as Goldfinger follows.
Perhaps it would be wiser to suspend your other activities.
Now, Mister Ling, please assure your principals Operation Grand Slam will have my undivided attention. Goldfinger leads him down a few steps and around a corner the building.
Now, there are certain matters we must discuss...
TILT UP as he rises above the louvers, looks to one side moves off.
Bond runs along the side of the building. He stops, plant his back again it, then darts to the bottom of the hillsi
Bond jumps over some barbed wired and heads into the wood  66.

- Bond sits on the ground and removes his backpack, looki down at the factory. He rubs his left arm. Suddenly he he a TWIG SNAP and looks up. - Someone is moving through the trees. - Bond runs forward then dives onto his belly. - He looks forward then lowers his head again. - The other person continues through the trees. - Bond lowers his head further then looks up. - The other person stalks forward holding a rifle. - Bond rounds the side of a tree and looks ahead. - The other person moves further ahead, then lies down pr and aims the rifle forward. - Bond dives at the shooter as the rifle is cocked. He pounces. The rifle's barrel tilts up, snagging a wire.
- A red light suddenly glows on a sensor board accompanie a wailing sound. - WIDER ANGLE: A Korean guard gets on a phone as another at the board.
Bond rolls over holding the shooter. Her face enters the moonlight. It is Tilly.
Let me go! You're breaking my back! Bond recognizes her but keeps holding her.
What the hell are you doing here?
I want to kill him.
Kill who?  67.
Goldfinger.
Well I want him alive.
I want him dead. He killed my sister.
T.M. Tilly Masterson! I knew your sister, Jill. I know what he died to her in Miami.
No you don't! Let me go!
If you wanted to kill him, why did you shoot at me?
I didn't! I was shooting at him!
Well, you're a lousy shot. A rifle fires.
But somebody else around here isn't. Come on! He pulls her to her feet as a rifle fires again. They run into the woods.
Bond and Tilly run through the woods, then suddenly stop look ahead.
stands between two Mercedes Benz cars and calls out in Ko
in the woods hear him and turn forward.
PAN on them as they run to Bond's Aston-Martin. A guard blocks their path.  68.

Quick! Get in the car! I'll take care of him. Tilly runs toward the Aston-Martin. Bond grabs the guard from behind and smashes his head aga the first Mercedes. The guard drops to the ground. Bond jumps forward.

- ANGLE ON THE ASTON-MARTIN: Tilly is already inside. Bon bounds into the driver's seat and starts the engine. The headlights go on. - Three Korean guards run through the woods. - The Aston-Martin takes off. What's with that trick pool table? Goldfinger crosses to the console as the table stops movi and the humming ends. He reaches out and turns three white dials. Indicator lig go on and another humming sound starts.
A large wood panel lowers over the windows.
Cover him!
Hey, cover those doors!
Turn those lights back on! Three gangsters back up in the dark. A large aerial photograph rises from the floor and interi lights go on.
There is no cause for alarm, gentlemen. He turns a black knob. The humming sound increases. He lo up. The large photograph flattens against the wall as side pa come into place beside it.  98.

I don't like being cooped up like this. -- What's that map doing there? Goldfinger takes a pool cue from a rack by the table. PAN him as he crosses to the aerial photo. It depicts Fort Kn and the surrounding area.
(pointing with the cue) This is my bank. The gold depository at Fort Knox, gentlemen. In its vaults are fifteen billion dollars -- the entire gold supply of the United States.
(laughing) Knock off Fort Knox?! The gangsters laugh at him.
Got a key or somethin'?
Of a kind. PAN on him as he walks back to the console.
There are thirty-five thousand troops stationed around there.
(setting down the cue) Forty-one thousand.

And who's going to say "boo" to them, Goldfinger? Goldfinger turns the white dials again and the humming so resumes. The bar starts to swivel around and the centre of the flo retracts, revealing a hidden model of Fort Knox. The gangsters panic.
Hey, what's going on here?!
Hey, what is this?!  99.
It's the floor!

Say, what is this, a merry-go- round?! The bar swivels into a new position. Goldfinger looks off lighting apparatus lowers from the ceiling above the mode The model starts to rise. The gangsters look at it in amazement. Goldfinger approac the model holding his pool cue.

Man has climbed Mount Everest. Gone to the bottom of the ocean. He has fired rockets to the moon. Split the atom. Achieved Miracles... (the humming stops) in every field of human endeavor -- except crime!

Bond paces to the door. He looks out through the bars. A Korean guard sits outside watching him. Bond waves to him. The guard looks back expressionless. Bond turns, paces to the far end of the cell and returns the bars. The guard sits staring at him. Bond waves to him again an turns away. The guard continues to watch expressionless. Bond paces to the bars again and smiles at the guard. The guard stares back. Bond winks at him. The guard stares ba Bond smiles and suddenly lowers himself below the window. The guard keeps looking. Bond is no longer visible.
gets up, walks to the door and looks through the bars. Th cell appears empty. He takes out a gun, unlocks the door and kicks it open.
The door slams against the inner wall. The guard walks in Bond hides above him in the rafters.  100. The guard looks around, seeing an empty cell.
Bond, above him, braces himself.

suddenly jumps down. He grabs the guard from behind. They tussle and fall to the floor. They struggle for the gun. Bond slams the guard's hand against the bed frame and the gun falls. The guard shoves Bond against the wall. Bond kicks him un the chin and the guard falls flat on his back. ZIP PAN over to the gun under the cot. Bond takes the gun his jacket and backs out of the cell as the guard lies unconscious in f.g.

Bond shuts the cell door behind him, lays the key on a pi rags and walks down the corridor putting on his jacket. As he nears the end of the corridor, we see a basement co room ahead containing a hydraulic lift and we hear voices above:
The underworld will rock with applause for centuries.
Cut the commercial.
Yeah, get to the point!
Seven of the gangsters are lined up on the platform facin Goldfinger. He holds the pool cue and approaches Solo.
You're wasting my time, Goldfinger. The depository is impregnable.
(steps forward counting on his fingers) Look, the joint is bomb-proof, electrified, lousy with machine guns, tear gas --  101.
Bear with me, please! Fort Knox is a bank, like any other. Larger, better protected perhaps, but nonetheless a bank! PAN OVER as he points the pool cue at the model.
It can be, I think the expression is, blown. ZOOM IN on the model. Bond's eyes look out through window the replica of Fort Knox.
My plan is foolproof, gentlemen.

Bond stands on the hydraulic platform. He jumps down, loo around, tears a piece of paper from a rolled-up document grabs a pencil. He runs back under the model and looks through it again. Meanwhile we hear Goldfinger continue:

I call it Operation Grand Slam. I have devoted fifteen years of my life to it. Every detail has been scrupulously prepared. Every eventuality has been considered. We'll operate on a split-second schedule. Your organization, Mister Midnight, brought ina consignment of these canisters...
Goldfinger holds up a gold canister the size of a wine bo
across the Canadian border. They contain Delta Nine.
Bond prepares to write on the piece of paper.
Delta Nine? What's that?  102.

(gesturing emphatically) An invisible nerve gas which disperses fifteen minutes after inducing complete unconsciousness for twenty-four hours! Goldfinger hands the canister to one of the gangsters and paces past them.
Tomorrow at dawn, the Flying Circus of my personal pilot, Miss Pussy Galore...
... Will spray it into the atmosphere! Bond starts writing. PAN OVER to the piece of paper. He writes: "Q07 to CIA
Once the population, including the military, has been immobilized, my task...

... force, which Mr. Strap and his people smuggled across the Rio Grande from Mexico, will approach Fort Knox in motorized equipment along Bullion Boulevard... He points to the model with the pool cue.

. which runs past the depository here, and intersects with Gold Vault Road. This fence surrounding the depository, as Mister Strap reminded us, is electrified. It will be dynamited. My task force will then move to the main entrance and demolish it.  103.
How, may I ask?

You made that possible, Mister Solo, by arranging, through your considerable influence in shipping circles, to bring through customs uninspected a consignment labeled machine parts. All that will then remain is to descend to the vaults where the bullion is stored.
I've heard enough.
Let him finish.
(interrupting) If you have no objection... (to Goldfinger) I'll take my money now.
What's the matter, Solo? Too big for you to handle? Goldfinger looks over at other gangsters. They look back him. He looks at another group of gangsters. They look ba Under the model, Bond watches.
Gentlemen, we must respect Mister Solo's decision. Please excuse me for a few minutes while I take care of him. Make yourselves comfortable. Goldfinger leads Solo toward the door.
Bond takes the Homer from his heel, folds the paper aroun and slips it into his pocket. He looks through the model again. He hears general hubbub from the gangsters, and a few clear words:
How do we get it out?  104.
That's the bit I want to hear.

Yeah, and it had better be good. TILT DOWN to Bond's feet. Suddenly a pair of hands grab h ankles and yank on them. He falls face-down onto the platform. The hands pull him back and hurl him against a wall. He t around and suddenly stops. His assailant is Pussy. She glares at him with her hands her hips.
Pussy! Well, who taught you judo? She holds her hand out. DOLLY BACK as she steps forward; guard crosses behind her.
The gun you took.
Oh, the gun. The gun, of course. He takes it from his pocket and hands it to her handle-fi She motions to him to go back down the corridor. He start walking. She hands the gun to one of the guards.
We must have a few fast falls together sometime.
Kisch steps forward, presses a button and sliding armoure doors glide shut.
DOLLY after Kisch turns to a control panel and switches o t.v. monitors. They show different angles on the rumpus r
Gangsters hover around the model.
Hey, Strap, y'know, if he's got the right answers, you and me don't even have to be there. The boys can handle everything.  105.
Kisch dons a gas mask. Then he presses a button on a cont panel. Indicator lights go on.
We see the fireplace hood shut over the grate and some li go off.
The gangsters react with panic.
Hey, they closed up the fireplace! PAN over to the wall-sized photo. A shielding lowers over sealing the room.
I don't like this! Four teargas canisters rise from a console table.
What's goin' on here?
Kisch turns a switch.
DOLLY IN as they start hissing.
Blue lights start flashing. The gangsters choke and run around.
The gas! Gangsters fall to the ground. The canisters keep hissing. The last of the gangsters drop to the ground.

A Korean guard loads bars of gold into the trunk of a car DOLLY BACK to show it is a Cadillac.  106. Goldfinger and Solo emerge through the front doorway of t house. Another guard follows behind them with a briefcase overcoat.

Such a pity you did not choose to remain with the others, Mister Solo. However... The guard closes the trunk. Solo glances up. Goldfinger notices and looks back. Pussy walks up to them with Bond. Bond takes his hand fro his pocket, holding the piece of paper with the Homer.
Ah, Mister Bond. I thought you were resting in your quarters.
Solo, Goldfinger, Pussy and Bond.
Oh, they are delightful, but it's much too nice to stay indoors. I ran into Miss Galore and she suggested that we join you.
(turning between the two men) Mister Solo, Mister Bond, another of my distinguished guests.
Hello.
Leaving us so soon, Mister Solo?
Unfortunately, he has a pressing engagement.
Yeah. I'd like to get started, Goldfinger. He calls behind him to the guard.
Boy!  107. Solo approaches the car followed by the guard.
Ah, when you gotta go, you gotta go. Solo opens the passenger door. Bond slips the paper into pocket.
My plane will get you to New York on time. With you excess luggage. (he laughs) Solo takes the briefcase and overcoat from the guard and into the car.
(closing the door) Allow me. Oddjob approaches from b.g.
My chauffeur's an excellent driver. You will be at the airport in a few minutes. Oddjob gets in behind the wheel.
Goodbye, Mister Solo. Some other time, perhaps...
(leaning forward) Happy landings, old boy. PAN on the car as it drives off.
Goldfinger, Pussy and Bond.
I found him under the model. Goldfinger looks at Bond. Bond looks back.
Operation Grand Slam. I did enjoy your briefing.  108. Goldfinger looks back at Bond. Bond looks back at Goldfin
(grins slightly) So did I. PAN on him as he walks off. Bond and Pussy watch him go. Goldfinger heads for the stables.
PAN on Oddjob's Cadillac as it drives by.

Johnnie again sits in the driver's seat of the Thunderbir He hears the scope beeping and looks at it. The beep indicator is moving. He gets out of the car and honks the horn. Felix hurries of the restaurant eating.
He's on the move! Felix takes another bite and heads for the car. Johnnie backs the car up. Felix rushes into the passenger seat and they take off.
turns a corner at "Joe's Drive-In" and heads up another street.
follows up the same street.
Felix looks at the scope. The beep indicator moves upward
Slow down. Don't crowd him. The Thunderbird keeps following.

cruises along. Solo sits impassively in the back seat as Oddjob drives.  109. The Cadillac passes under bridge where a sign reads, "INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT." Then it passes a Sign at the sid the road that reads, "AIRPORT."
(looking back) Are you blind or something? You missed the turn! Oddjob looks purposefully ahead.

The Cadillac rounds a corner. It stops at the side of the road. Solo, puzzled, looks back. Oddjob picks up a pistol with a silencer and aims it at h Solo looks forward again and sees the gun. His eyes open in shock. Oddjob shoots him in the chest. Solo falls back against h seat then drops out of view. Oddjob peers down at him smugly.
drives forward again.
Felix studies the scope.
Hmm. He turned to the right just ahead here somewhere. The Thunderbird stops, backs up and heads in a different direction.
drives serenely.
The Cadillac races by under a bridge.
The beeping continues.  110.
(glancing at the scope) Where's this old pal of yours heading?
Ten'll get you one, it's a drink or a dame. Johnnie looks at him and smiles.
The Thunderbird continues under the same bridge.
Oddjob keeps driving serenely.
He turns into a scrap yard where scrap metal is piled int pyramids . A sign on the wall reads, "ATLANTIC IRON & MET

Oddjob pulls to a stop, gets out of the Cadillac and walk away. Just then grab hooks descend onto the car. They surround roof, gripping the car, and raise it into the air. The hooks swing the car overhead then drop it into a car- crushing machine. The flanges of the machine start to clo on the car.

The machine's hydraulics compress the car into a foot-squ cube. The flanges retract and a gateway opens. A metal arm push the cube out through the gateway. An electromagnet snags the cube from above. It lifts the into the air then lowers it into the back of Oddjob's blu pickup truck as Oddjob (looking thinner) approaches the t Oddjob gets in behind the wheel and glances back as the c is lowered into place. Oddjob drives away.  111.
Felix tries adjusting the controls of the scope but the beeping has stopped.
Dead.
Mechanical failure maybe.
Unless he switched it off. Felix keeps trying to adjust the scope.
Why would he do that?
Drive to the farm. It's all we can do.
Right. PAN on the Thunderbird as it drives on. Then the pickup t comes down the other side of the road. PAN on it into the other direction.
Pussy sits at a table with Goldfinger. A SERVANT sets min juleps in front of them.
Thank you. The servant moves off. DOLLY in to a tighter two-shot of Pussy and Goldfinger.
Your share of Operation Grand Slam will make you a very rich woman, my dear.
Why else would I be in it, Mister Goldfinger? She reaches for her glass. He strokes her hand.  112.
You'll retire to England, I suppose? He continues stroking her hand.
No. I've spotted a little island in the Bahamas. I'll hang up a sign -- She takes the glass, rejecting Goldfinger's hand.
-- no trespassing, and go back to nature. Goldfinger taps the tabletop, acknowledging the rejection
Pussy, Goldfinger and Kisch. Kisch walks up to them.
Yes, Kisch?
Two men in a car, with binoculars.
Touts looking for racing tips.
Felix and Johnnie stand at a fence, the Thunderbird parke behind them. Felix hands Johnnie a pair of binoculars. Fe looks through them.
starts thinking.
There is another possibility, however. Kisch, ask Mister Bond to join us. Kisch walks off. DOLLY IN on Pussy and Goldfinger.  113.

(to Pussy) We were quite right to spare Mister Bond's life in Switzerland. If those gentlemen are his friends, let us convince them he needs no assistance. For their benefit, Pussy, let's make him as happy as possible. I suggest you change into something more suitable.
Certainly. (sets her glass down) Business before pleasure. He chortles. She gets up. Her chortles again as he watche her go, then turns to his drink.

Bond sits on the cot, his back against the wall and legs V-position, wearing his suit. DOLLY BACK and PAN OVER to reveal three guards watching him. Kisch appears in the doorway and gestures to Bond with a
He wants you. Bond gets up.
Felix and Johnnie stand looking over the fence, Felix wit binoculars. He pans over, seeing something.

head_text.subj: THE PORCH OF THE PLANTATION HOUSE

text: Kisch follows Bond to the porch where Goldfinger still si the table.
(casually, gesturing) Ah, Mister Bond. Sit down, please. A mint julep? Traditional, but satisfying.
Yes, thanks. (to the servant) Sour mash, but not too sweet, please.  114. The servant nods and walks away.
(slips his hands in his pockets) You disappoint me, Goldfinger. You know Operation Grand Slam simply won't work. Incidentally, Delta Nine nerve gas is fatal.
You are unusually well informed, Mr. Bond. The servant approaches with Bond's drink on a tray.
You'll kill sixty-thousand people uselessly. (to servant) Ah! He takes his drink. The servant moves off. Kisch, though, lingers behind them.
American motorists kill that many every two years.

Yes, well, I've worked out a few statistics of my own. (sits across the table from him) Fifteen billion dollars in gold bullion weighs ten thousand, five hundred tons. Sixty men would take twelve days to load it onto two hundred trucks. Now, at the most, you're going to have two hours before the army, navy, air force, marines move in and make you put it back.
Who mentioned anything about removing it? Bond stops drinking. Kisch leans back against a pillar be them, watching.
Is the julep tart enough for you?
(thinking) You plan to break into the world's largest bank, but not to steal anything. Why?
Go on, Mister Bond.
Mister Ling, the Red Chinese agent at the factory. He's a specialist in nuclear fission. -- But of course! Goldfinger smiles back at him.
His government's given you a bomb!
I prefer to call it an atomic device. It's small, but particularly dirty.
Cobalt and iodine?
Precisely.
Well, if you explode it in Fort Knox, the, uh, entire gold supply of the United States will be radioactive for... fifty-seven years!
Fifty-eight, to be exact.
I apologize, Goldfinger. It's an inspired deal. They get what they want -- economic chaos in the West -- and the value of your gold increases many times.
I conservatively estimate ten times. 115.  116.
Brilliant. But the atomic device, as you call it, is already, obviously in this country.
Obviously.
But bringing it to Fort Knox, uh, undetected could be risky -- very risky.

Oh the contrary, Mister Bond. The risk is all on your side. If the authorities should attempt to locate it, who knows where it might be exploded, eh? Perhaps the Polaris submarine pens at New London, Cape Kennedy, near the White House... But we are speculating idly. Operation Grand Slam will be successful. You will be there to see for yourself -- to closely for comfort, I'm afraid.
Bond looks off. He sees the blue pickup truck returning. truck stops in front of the house. Goldfinger approaches it, followed by Bond.
Forgive me, Mister Bond, but, uh, I must arrange to separate my gold from the late Mister Solo. Goldfinger approaches the pickup truck.
As you said he had a pressing engagement. As Goldfinger reaches the back of the truck, Pussy emerge through the front door of the house wearing casual clothe

Ah, very chic, Miss Galore. (to Bond) Don't you agree? Please entertain Mister Bond for me, Pussy. I'll join you both later.  117. He bangs on the back of the truck and walks off with it. Pussy crosses behind Bond and links an arm through his.
Well, how about it, handsome? Don't you think it's about time we got to know each other socially?
Well, the new Miss Galore. Where do you hide you gold knuckles in this outfit?
(escorting him forward) Oh, uh, I never carry weapons after business hours.
Yeah? So you're off duty.
I'm completely defenseless.
(looking at her) So am I. Pussy laughs.
Felix continues looking through the binoculars, Johnnie b him.
Bond and Pussy walk casually across the grounds toward a stable.
lowers the binoculars and passes them to Johnnie.
That's my James.
They walk past the stable, her arm still linked through h
Beautiful place Goldfinger has here.  118.
Yes. I'm glad you're enjoying it.
Too bad it all has to end tomorrow morning. He faces Pussy. She looks back at him.
He's quite mad, you know. Pussy keeps looking at him. Bond turns to the entrance to the stable.
Well, now. What do we have here? He walks inside, Pussy following.
Felix looks through the binoculars again.
Double-o-seven seems to have the situation well in hand. Come on, I'm bushed. Let's get back to the motel. They turn away toward the Thunderbird.
Bond paces in front of Pussy.
You're quite a girl, Pussy.
I'm strictly the outdoor type.
I'd like to think you're not in on all of this, uh, caper.
Skip it. I'm not interested. Let's go. He grabs her arm and turns her back.  119.
What would it take for you to see things my way?
A lot more than you've got.
(looking into her eyes) How do you know?
(looking back) I don't want to know. She turns to the door again. He grabs her and holds her b
Isn't it customary to grant the condemned man his last request?
You've asked for this. She hurls him with a Judo move. He summersaults and lands his butt in hay. He looks back at her. She exhales. Pussy walks up to him.
Get up! Bond grabs her leg and drops her into the hay.

(rising) Certainly. He offers a hand to help her up. She rises. She tries to throw him but he twists her around and tosses her over hi back. She lands in the hay. She recovers and looks back, glaring. Bond smiles, walks toward her and sits beside her.

There. Now let's both play. She tries to kick him but he jumps on top of her. She pla her hands at his throat, trying to push him away, but he steadily lowers himself. She turns her head to the side.  120. Bond's mouth comes down on hers and they kiss. Struggling first, Pussy finally relents and lets him kiss her. Her h move from his neck to his shoulders, then the flings her around him.
An airplane's propellers rev up.

A Korean guard check the gas canister mounted under the w of one of the planes. He runs to the other wing and check the canister there as well. Another guard in b.g. looks under the wing of another pla (but there are no canisters there).
Pussy Galore to Champagne leader. Commence Rock-a-Bye Baby. Good luck. The guards back away. PAN on the five planes as they taxi down a runway.
PAN on the planes as they take off.
The planes fly in V-formation.
DENISE is flying and talks into her mic.
Speed two-two-o. Wind check westerly.
fly across the sky.  121.
looking pleased, glances down at her controls.
They fly over green terrain.
talks into her mic.
Champagne leader to Champagne section. Commence dive -- now.
They fly in V-formation over a forest approaching Fort Kn extreme b.g.
talks into her mic again.
Ready for Rock-a-Bye Baby. Commence spray on countdown. Five...
MAGGIE is at her controls.
four...
LESLEY is at her controls.
three...
JANE is at the controls.
She speaks the final word into the mic.
zero.
begin to spray smoky gas.
They continue flying in V-formation right over Fort Knox.
The planes continue over Fort Knox and separate from formation.
Smoky gas continues to shoot from a canister.
fly off in different directions.
Jane sits at the controls, looking over.
pass over planes sitting on a tarmac and various building PAN on them to reveal a sign on a brick building that rea
We pass over barracks approaching two water towers.
Denise at the controls looks down.
She begins flying past them.
She continues past them.  123.
More barracks approach.
Smoky gas shoots out from the canisters as the plane cros the barracks.
A phalanx of marching men suddenly fall to the ground as plane passes over the barracks beside them.
flies over other roofs.
Another phalanx of marching men fall.
More white smoke shoots from the canisters as the plane f over more barracks then crosses a tall building.
Leslie is at the controls.
A number of soldiers stand grouped together as she approa
A group of men collapse.
The plane continues spraying gas as it passes overhead.
A group of soldiers on a trestle bench fall unconscious. another group of men collapse.
The plane angles up into the air.
looks down.  124.
She passes over rows of battle tanks.
more soldiers drop to the ground.
Another plane flies over another row of tanks and the sol there collapse, then the plane circles overhead. It passe the roofs of buildings.
Denise looks down.
Two planes pass overhead and more soldiers fall to the gr
A plane passes over another group of soldiers. They colla
flies over a building.
A group of soldiers in f.g. collapse. Then a row of soldi behind them doing calisthenics drop to the ground.
The plane rises from the soldiers into the air.
flies over a rooftop.
Denise looks down, another plane visible in b.g.
The buildings appear deserted.

- A group of soldiers lie collapsed on the ground.  125. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed in a jeep. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed in a street. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed near trucks. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed near buildings. TILT DOWN to even more collapsed soldiers on grass nearby
(into her mic) Champagne leader to Grand Slam task force leader. The baby is asleep.
A convoy awaits -- three trucks, a jeep and an ambulance. DENISE (0.S., filtered) I repeat: the baby is asleep. We're going home now.
DOLLY BACK past two Koreans inside to reveal Kisch blowin whistle. The Koreans wear their blue jumpsuits and yellow sashes; Kisch wears green army fatigues.
Bond sits in back wearing a black suit. He is handcuffed Oddjob. Oddjob tosses him a gas mask.
Argh! Bond catches it and Oddjob climbs in beside him.
puts on a gas mask and gets into the jeep.
The vehicles take off, the jeep in the lead.
PAN as they turn a corner to reveal two crashed cars. One overturned and from the other a man's body leans out.
The convoy heads up the street and passes soldiers lying the ground and others lying in a jeep.
rounds another corner. PAN on them as they pass more sold lying on the ground.
The convoy rounds another corner. Ahead lays Fort Knox. A green car rests in a ditch at the side of the road and Felix' head is visible leaning dead out a rear window. Johnnie lies beside him.
Kisch and the other two men in gas masks look to the side
As they approach it they see an overturned truck and many soldiers lying at the side of the road.
Kisch looks ahead.
comes closer. More soldiers lie in another jeep at the ot side of the road.
approaches the gate. Bond and Oddjob are in the bed of th last truck. PAN over to the green car in the ditch and ZO IN on Felix, lying still.

The convoy passes a sign that reads "STOP AT RED SIGNAL." halts at the gate to Fort Knox. Kisch alights from the je One of the Koreans hands him a wooden box.  127. Kisch opens it. Inside is a measuring device with a meter registering "TOXIC UNITS PER CC X100" and a label that sa "AURIC SPECTROMETER." The needle is at zero. Kisch gives the box back to the Korean.
A tarpaulin is raised, revealing a dozen guards in gas ma Kisch pulls off his mask and blows his whistle.
Oddjob removes his mask and gestures to Bond to do the sa

Guards from the first truck carry explosive cylinders to gate. They lay them at the base of the gate. A guard attaches a wire to the explosives as Kisch looks The guard runs back to the jeep unspooling the wire. Anot guard attaches it to a detonator and turns the handle. The gate explodes, sending pieces flying. Bond looks back at the explosion. The jeep drives through the gateway.

head_text.subj: ON THE GROUNDS OF FORT KNOX

text: The jeep, followed by the trucks, turns down a circular d that runs past the fort. PAN over to the front entrance, where lettering over the doorway reads "UNITED STATES

head_text.subj: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT

text: The ambulance pulls to one side, its back to the deposito as the other vehicles take positions nearby. Two guards open a panel on the side of the ambulance, revealing control switches. They back away as Kisch walks and turns a dial. The top of the ambulance opens up. DOLLY IN as a laser gu rises from inside the ambulance, pointing at the fort. Tw guards ride the lift up with it.
alight from the back of the truck.  128.

head_text.subj: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT

text: Kisch signals to the ambulance driver.

Chafoo! The ambulance backs up to the side door of the fort. Bond Oddjob stand nearby. The guards activate the laser, sending a red beam into th of the door. Bond and Oddjob step closer and watch. The b starts cutting across the top of the door. The guards aim it further along. Kisch watches. The beam keeps cutting. The guards aim it further to the side. Bond and Oddjob wa The beam reaches the other end of the door. Kisch signals to four guards with a chain. Two of them at it to the back of the ambulance and the other two run to fort's door A guard turns the laser off.

The door falls to the floor and is dragged away by the ambulance. Kisch enters and moves to another door as guar run past him. Two guards take a trolley; another runs upstairs to a con room; another poses with a machine gun. The guards with t trolley run outside with it as Kisch presses a button and opens another door.
A group of collapsed soldiers lie in a jeep in f.g. asa helicopter flies across the fort. Bond and Oddjob look up it.

head_text.subj: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT

text: The helicopter passes over the building.
Through the open doors we see the helicopter come in for landing.  129.

Bond and Oddjob watch the chopper land. Goldfinger emerges from the chopper wearing a brown overc and a scarf, followed by Ling carrying a small box. Pussy in the pilot's seat, all in white. Goldfinger walks up to Bond.

Good morning, Mister Bond. For once you are exactly where I want you. Bond looks over at Pussy. She looks back at him, concerne then ahead at the fort. Guard push the trolley away from the chopper. The trolley bears a large silver cabinet. DOLLY BACK as the guards wheel it into the reception area other guards who man the doorway. Bond, Goldfinger, Oddjo Kisch and Ling follow. Ling unlocks the top of the cabine and gestures to the guards. Two guards open the top of the cabinet, revealing shieldi and controls. Ling sets his box on the shielding. Bond, Goldfinger and Oddjob look on. Ling takes a primer from the box and places it in a slot the controls. Goldfinger signals up to the control room. A guard nods, turns to a switchboard and looks down through a viewer.
There are two rows of numbers. The top row reads "92255." The bottom row reads "10085." Both change to "36104."

a round door with a handle in the middle begins to open. Bond and Oddjob look on. The door swings all the way open, revealing a gantry and stairs inside. Flooring slides into place at the base of entryway.

Ling turns a control dial then turns a key and removes it the primer. The device begins emitting a rhythmic humming  130. Goldfinger, looking on with Bond and Oddjob, checks his w and winds it. Guards close the top of the cabinet and Ling locks the to ZOOM IN to a timer beside the controls that starts counti down from "354."
The scope begins oscillating with a wave signal sound.
Felix opens his eyes and rises. DOLLY BACK to reveal a SCIENTIST in glasses in the rear.
The bomb's here.
Let's get moving, brigadier. A BRIGADIER GENERAL rises in the passenger seat and a LT. COLONEL rises in the driver seat.
Right, Jack. Move in.
(into a phone) Move in, commando tactics. PAN OVER to reveal Fort Knox down the road. The soldiers were lying "dead" get up. A SOLDIER crouches just outside Felix' car speaking into a microphone.
Minimum offensive fire until I signal bomb has been neutralized.
Come on! The men jump out as the Lt. Colonel remains on the phone.
(on phone) Minimum offensive fire until I signal bomb has been neutralized. Bomb disposal unit to accompany
Guards move the trolley in across a bridge. Bond and Oddj follow.
It is a four-story tall cathedral of gold. Stairs lead do from each level. Gold bars are stacked in gigantic barred cages. Guards move the trolley to a lift.

Bond, Oddjob and Goldfinger walk up to the trolley. Kisch unlocks the handcuffs from Oddjob's wrist. Meanwhile, Goldfinger looks hungrily to the side. TILT DO stacks of gold bars in a cage. Goldfinger looks up at Bon again. Kisch attaches the handcuffs to the trolley, then he and Oddjob walk away.
(with a slight bow) Goodbye, Mister Bond. He signals to Kisch, who presses a button on the lift.

descends with Bond on it. ZOOM BACK to an extreme wide sh of the vault as Bond approaches ground level. Goldfinger turns away, leaving Oddjob at the lift doors looking down. The lift arrives at ground level. Bond looks at the timer It counts from "256" to "254." He reaches for the control panel.
Goldfinger exits the vault and walks over to Ling.
Mister Ling, it is merely a matter of timing and...
Army soldiers grab some of Goldfinger's guards from behin Other guards fire machines guns back at them.  132.
Guards back into the area firing guns. Goldfinger suddenl runs up the stairs to the control room.
Goldfinger looks into the viewer and starts turning dials scrambling the combination to the vault.
The door starts to close. Oddjob and Kisch are in b.g. Kisch sees the door moving and runs for it. The door clos on him.
Goldfinger pulls off his overcoat and scarf, revealing an officer's uniform underneath. He puts on a green cap.
Pussy looks at the fighting and reaches for the controls
Goldfinger straightens his green cap, pulls a gold revolv from inside his coat and runs from the room.
Goldfinger runs down the stairs.

(calling to him) Goldfinger! Just then three soldiers outside the doorway with machine and shoot a guard. Ling yells helplessly to Goldfinger in Chinese. Goldfinge shoots him. Ling falls dead to the floor. Four soldiers run in. Goldfinger hurries to them, pointin Ling.

He's one of them! So's the girl! I'll get her, you get the door open! The soldiers move forward. Goldfinger picks up a machine from a fallen guard and shoots them all in the back.  133. They all fall to the floor dead. Goldfinger sets down the machine gun, picks up his gold revolver and runs outside. explosion goes off just beyond the helicopter.
Bond struggles to lift the cover of the container.
Kisch pushes and knocks on it, then turns to Oddjob.
We're trapped. Oddjob steps back from the lift doors and turns to face h
The bomb. I'll take the fuse out. Kisch runs for the lift. Oddjob blocks him and grabs his shoulders.
Don't be a fool! You can be a hero. I'm not. Kisch breaks away and runs around the far corner of the walkway. Oddjob chases him.
Oddjob catches up to Kisch and grabs him near a railing. Kisch screams.

No! No! Bond looks up. Oddjob hurls Kisch over the railing, sending his body somersaulting down. Bond hears the crash of the body on the floor. He looks around the corner of the lift. He sees Oddjob up above looking down. Then he looks down.
lies atop bars covering a cage in the floor. ZOOM IN to Kisch's shirt pocket. It bulges slightly from a key insid  134.
looks up again at Oddjob, who looks down at him. Then Bon grabs the trolley and starts moving it toward Kisch's bod
Bond moves the trolley around the corner of the lift.
four stories above sees what he's doing and starts to run

- DOLLY BACK as Bond pulls the trolley closer to Kisch. H looks up. - Oddjob runs down a flight of stairs, reaches a landing rounds a corner. Directly below is Bond with the trolley, arriving at the bars to the floor-cage. - Bond steps onto a bar and reaches down for Kisch's pock - Oddjob rounds another landing. - Bond reaches closer to Kisch's pocket. - Oddjob stops on the next landing and looks at him, then keeps running. - Bond pulls a key from Kisch's pocket. He hears Oddjob's approaching footsteps and glances up, then PAN ON HIM as jumps back to the trolley and puts the key in the handcuf - EXTREME WIDE ANGLE: Oddjob reaches the last landing. - He takes off his bowler hat. - Bond looks up at him. - Oddjob hurls the hat. It whooshes through the air. Bond ducks and the hat passes just over his head, landing the bars of the floor-cage. Bond looks back at Oddjob. - Oddjob climbs over the railing at the landing. - Bond turns the key in the handcuffs. - Oddjob jumps down to the floor and starts to run. - Bond unlocks the handcuffs and darts the other way.  135. - EXTREME WIDE ANGLE: Bond runs toward a barred cage in t back wall as Oddjob runs after him. - Oddjob stops near the lift and picks up his hat. PAN on as he crosses to the other side of the lift and looks at who backs up almost against the cage. There is a blue mechanized dolly bearing gold bars between Oddjob and Bon Oddjob aims the hat at Bond and throws it. - The hat sails high and severs a heavy electrical cable, sending down a cascade of sparks. - Bond looks up at the sparks as the cable falls. - The cable lands on the floor next to the hat, still sho sparks. - Bond looks up at Oddjob. - Oddjob straightens himself. - Bond grabs a gold bar from the dolly and hurls it at hi - The bar bounces harmlessly off Oddjob's chest and falls the floor. - Bond looks in surprise, almost admiration, at Oddjob, a darts off to the side. - The timer on the bomb goes from "216" to "213." - PAN on Oddjob as he approaches Bond. Bond positions him in a stance for a fight. Bond jumps at Oddjob and throws arms around Oddjob's neck. - CLOSER ANGLE: As Bond clings to Oddjob's neck, Oddjob p him up like a doll. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob throws him against the wall. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond lands on the floor beside a trolley loaded with gold bars. He finds a large wooden staff behi the trolley and picks it up. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond angles the staff at Oddjob. Oddjob ba up. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond lunges at him with it. Oddjob dodges from it and the end of the staff hits the wall. Oddjob ju chops right through it, breaking it in two. Bond keeps hi fist around the smaller half. - Oddjob smiles at Bond.  136. - Bond smashes him in the face with the broken staff. Oddjob's head barely turns. - Oddjob looks back at him grinning. - Bond tries to smash Oddjob in the face again. - Oddjob grabs his arm. - Oddjob slams him against the wall. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob throws him sliding across the floor moves to follow.

- Korean guards in the entryway fire machine guns at U.S. troops outside. A number of soldiers fall. - The guards run back into the reception area. - The soldiers run to the entryway and start to fire insi PAN over to show the guards falling.

- Bond slides on his back along the floor, landing near another mechanized dolly loaded with gold bars. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond grabs a metal lever on the dolly as Oddjob watches in f.g. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond pulls off the lever. - PAN on Oddjob as he positions himself to face him. - Bond approaches him, raising the lever, and swings it a head. Oddjob ducks, avoiding it. Bond raises the lever again. Oddjob grabs his arm and squeezes it and the lever drops. Then Oddjob grabs Bond under the arm. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob hurls him past the bomb. - Bond lands against the wall of the lift. - The timer ticks down from "147" to "145." - Oddjob grabs Bond again and throws him toward the side Bond falls. - Bond rolls over near a cage in the wall then rises. Odd lunges at him. Bond grabs Oddjob's arm in a judo hold and thrusts him toward the wall.  137. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond presses Oddjob's shoulder against th wall but without effect. Oddjob replies with a judo-chop Bond's lower back. Bond gasps and releases his grip and Oddjob flings him backwards. - Bond lands against the cage in the side wall, breathles He sinks down against the bars breathing heavily. - Oddjob rises and smiles at him again. - Bond looks back exhausted. - Oddjob brings down another judo-chop. - His hand strikes Bond in the side. Bond doubles over. Oddjob grabs him around the neck and throws him at the ba wall. - Bond falls and slides toward the hat and smoldering cab - Bond comes to a stop, the hat right in front of him. Bo raises himself onto his elbow and looks up. - Oddjob approaches him. - Bond stares back. - The timer ticks down from "127" to "125." - Oddjob stops and gestures to Bond to get up. - Bond looks down at the hat and grabs it. - Oddjob suddenly looks concerned and takes a step back. - Bond rises with the hat. - PAN ON Oddjob as he stealthily backs to the side. - POV FROM INSIDE THE CAGE: Bond circles in front of Oddj who keeps backing away. - Oddjob backs up further toward the cage. - Bond moves forward with the hat. - Oddjob backs further away; the cage bars are now right behind him. - Bond hurls the hat at him. - Oddjob ducks. The hat sails past him and lodges between bars with a clang. Oddjob looks back at it.  138. - Bond looks at Oddjob. - Oddjob smiles back. - Bond keeps looking at Oddjob.

- Oddjob turns to get his hat. - Bond looks down. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond suddenly dives and grabs the broken c as Oddjob reaches for his hat. - Oddjob grips the hat. - Bond touches the cable to a cage bar. - Oddjob screams as sparks fly from the hat and there is sizzling sound. - WIDER ANGLE: The sparks keep flying. Oddjob, still hold the hat, falls back against the cage bars as Bond keeps holding the cable against the bar, electrocuting him. - Bond rubs the cable against the bar. - LOW ANGLE: Oddjob falls forward and lands on his chest Bond watches from b.g. - Bond looks at Oddjob's body then jumps to his feet.
Bond runs to the trolley and looks at the timer. It ticks down from "059" to "054." Bond slaps the cabinet's lid an looks about him, then down at where Kisch lies.
- In the entryway, American troops continue to fire. - More Korean guards fall dead. The corpse of an Army sol lies among them.

Bond reaches into the cage behind Kisch's body and takes gold ingots. He steps back to the bomb, puts an ingot on the lid and bangs on its underside. The lid stays locked. Bond turns into a different position.  139.
Bond places an ingot under the lid and hammers on it from below with the other.
clicks down from "049" to "047."
Korean guards in f.g. fire at the entryway.
A soldier runs past the entryway lobbing a hand grenade i es other soldiers run behind him. The grenade explodes in
A SOLDIER runs in and mounts the stairs to the control ro
They fire at him.
The soldier dives into the control room.
The soldier quickly turns dials on the control panel.
The top row of numbers stays at "36104" while the bottom changes from "76755" to "36104."
The vault door swings open as the guards keep firing mach guns. It shoves one of the guards against a railing.
The door crushes the guard against it.
Korean guards back into the vault firing their machine gu ahead of them.  140.
still banging on the ingot looks up at the battle.
A gunshot drops a Korean guard dead.
Other Korean guards run down a side walkway. A gunshot so and one of them falls dead with a scream.
looks up again then down at the counter. It drops from "0 to "036." He bangs again on the underside of the lid.
Soldiers firing rifles pass through the entrance to the v
Soldiers run inside as guards flee them into b.g.
bangs again on the underside of the lid. He hears more gunfire and looks up.
A Korean guard clutches his stomach and falls over the railing, somersaulting four levels to the floor.
As Bond pounds on the lid again, a guard stops on a landi above him and aims a pistol at him.
A soldier fires a machine gun at the guard.
The guard falls over the railing to the floor, and anothe guard drops dead on a catwalk behind him.  141.

smashes the underside of the lid again. It pops open, the lock broken! Bond reaches for the lid to raise it and gla at the counter. The counter drops from "032" to "030." Bond throws back the lid. DOLLY IN on the bomb as he open the inner casing to reveal a mechanism with spinning whee and gears.

- DOLLY IN on him as he looks down at the contraption, clueless as to what to do. He looks at the timer. - The timer drops from "026" to "024." - Bond keeps looking down. - BOND'S POV - THE MACHINERY: PAN back and forth across i show one spinning gear after another. - Bond looks on helplessly. He reaches forward. - His hands touch a wire, then a spinning disk, trying to it. - The timer drops from "019" to "017." - Bond keeps looking down, then to one side. Meanwhile th smoke of rifle-fire bursts behind him. - His hand touches a turning wheel.
THREE SOLDIERS run in bearing rifles, followed by Felix, Johnnie and THREE UNIFORMED OFFICERS.
(shouting) Come on, fellas! Get going! Hurry up!
Bond's hands try again to stop the mechanism, without suc
looks down frantically.  142.
Soldiers and civilians run around a landing and down more stairs.
glances down at the timer. It descends from "014" to "012
A SCIENTIST wearing glasses and a hat rounds the corner, followed by a soldier with a rifle.
keeps looking down. His hands try again to stop the gears turning. Then he gr some wires. Bond's face registers exertion as he tries to pull the wi apart. The timer drops from "010" to "009."
Bond's hands keep pulling them, then suddenly another han reaches in and flips a switch at the side of the machiner The mechanism stops. TILT UP to the scientist. He looks d at the timer.
is stopped at "007."
looks over at him.
What kept you?
looks up at Bond.
TRACK BACK on Felix as he runs up to Bond with Johnnie an some military officers.  143.
You okay, James? Where's your butler friend?
looks up at Felix.
Oh, he blew a fuse. PAN on Bond as he walks over to Felix.
Three more ticks and Mister Goldfinger would have hit the jackpot. The scientist walks up, shows Felix the primer and walks with it.
Did you get him?
Not yet, but he won't get far.
And Pussy?
She helped us switch the gas in the canisters. By the way, what made her call Washington? DOLLY IN on Bond.
(straight - faced) I must have appealed to her maternal instincts. He looks at Felix.
A convoy approaches a plane -- a black convertible, a bla limousine and a white station wagon. The vehicles stop. Felix gets out of the back seat of the convertible, followed by Bond.
C'mon, James. Get aboard. You can't keep the President waiting. DOLLY with them as they walk to the plane.
Special plane. Lunch at the white House. How come?
The President wants to thank you personally.
(straightening his cuffs) Oh, it was nothing, really.
I know that, but he doesn't.
I suppose I'll be able to get a drink here? They reach the plane.
I told the stewardess liquor for three.
(looking back at him) Who are the other two?
Oh, there are no other two. Bond grins. Felix holds his hand out and they shake hands
Goodbye, Felix.
So long, James. Good luck. Bond turns to a man in an Army uniform and shakes his han
Thank you, brigadier. Bond walks up the steps to the plane.
Good luck.  145. Bond looks back.
Felix, Johnnie, the brigadier and other officers wave to
salutes them and steps into the fuselage.
Bond's plane taxis away from the group.
The plane flies through a cloudy sky. Lettering on the pl says "UNITED STATES."
Bond, sitting in a swivel chair, undoes his seatbelt and out the window.
Bond adjusts an overhead air-jet then leans forward again looking out the window.

head_text.subj: A SET OF CURTAINS TO THE COCKPIT

text: The curtains suddenly part and Goldfinger steps into the in his military uniform holding his gold revolver.
THREE CREWMEN struggle with ropes around their arms and l and gags in their mouths.
Bond swivels around -- and sees Goldfinger. His expressio sinks.
aims his gun at Bond.
I am glad to have you aboard, Mister Bond.  146.
looks back at him.
Well, congratulations on your promotion, Goldfinger.
He walks closer to Bond.
Are you having lunch at the White House, too?
In two hours, I shall be in Cuba. And you have interfered with my plans for the last time, Mister Bond. Goldfinger cocks the trigger. Bond looks up at him.
It's, uh, very dangerous to fire guns in planes. I even had to warn Pussy about it. Er, by the way, where is she?
I will deal with her later.
At the moment, she is where she ought to be -- at the controls. Goldfinger gestures forward with the gun. Bond suddenly g his arm. He swings Goldfinger around, grabbing for the gu
Bond and Goldfinger struggle over the gun.
Goldfinger strikes Bond twice on the neck with the gun. B grabs Goldfinger's arm and pushes him backwards, then Goldfinger turns and flings Bond onto one of the seats.  147.
punches Goldfinger in the jaw.
falls backwards. Bond jumps up and hits him in the chest.
Bond hits Goldfinger in the chest again and grabs the arm holding the gun. Goldfinger flings his arms around Bond's torso.
Bond and Goldfinger struggle over the gun. It fires.
bursts.
All meters suddenly drop.
Bond hangs onto a rail as Goldfinger is sucked forward.
continues to suck air out.
Goldfinger flies head-first toward the open window.
Goldfinger swivels and the suction pulls him legs-first t the window.
The suction pulls Goldfinger's legs through the window. P over to his screaming face.
hangs onto the railing, being almost sucked out of the pl himself.  148.
Goldfinger is sucked out into space.
Bond continues to hang from the rail as everything not ti down is sucked out the window.
clutches the rail.
The plane dives toward the ground.
Pussy pulls back uselessly on the stick.
It registers "8" out of "35," then rises a few points.
falls onto a couch.
Pussy keeps pulling back on the stick.
Bond struggles to his feet and starts moving toward the cockpit.
The three crewmen, still bound and gagged, now lie uncons in f.g. An ARMY OFFICER in the entryway waves outside. Fe and Johnnie run in and all three run toward the crewmen.
Bond has almost reached the cockpit.
Pussy keeps pulling back on the stick. Bond enters.
Pussy!  149. She looks up at him.
What happened? Where's Goldfinger? Bond grabs the co-pilot stick and tries to steer it.
Playing his golden harp.
It continues to dive.
It's no good! Bond keeps trying to steady the stick. He looks ahead.
Half a dozen men look at a scope, including Felix and Joh
A glowing dot drops from 8,000 to 5,000 feet.
It keeps diving.
Bond looks at Pussy. Pussy looks back helplessly.
The men keep looking at the scope.
The dot is at 4,000 feet, but now another dot appears, dropping to 2,000 feet.
It dives into the ocean and crashes.
A helicopter flies overhead.  150.
Felix sits in the passenger seat looking down, the PILOT beside him.
They fly over numerous trees, no sign of Bond.
Felix looks ahead, then in the other direction.
It continues to pass overhead. Pussy rises and waves her white jacket at it.
continues to wave at it. Suddenly:
Oh, no, you don't. He grabs her ankle. She tumbles down into his arm, a parachute behind them.
This is no time to be rescued. They kiss passionately. Bond grabs the edge of the parach and pulls it over them.
TILT UP from the parachute to the helicopter hovering pointlessly above. FADE OUT.
